definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: The text is a sane conversation with millions of participants.
sentences.chinese: 文本是一次与无数参与者的理智交谈。

sentences.english: However some grownup parents never figure out how to talk to a child.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多家长怎么也学不会正确地和孩子交谈。

sentences.english: They all stopped working and were talking excitedly.
sentences.chinese: 他们都停下手中的活儿，激动地交谈起来。

sentences.english: While reluctant to criticize the status quo, the guides often let things slip out in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 导游不愿意批评现状，但在交谈中会不时漏嘴。

sentences.english: My employer told me not to speak to the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 我的雇主告诉我不可跟邻居交谈。

sentences.english: Some girls sprang up a dance immediately, other of just stand the side of the side confabulation see.
sentences.chinese: 一些女孩立刻跳起了舞，其他的只是站着边交谈边看。

sentences.english: Multi-actor dialog timeline for actor conversations.
sentences.chinese: 多演员的演员交谈对话的时间表。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe I was speaking to the player I grew up idolising.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢相信我和梦想中的偶像在交谈。

sentences.english: where apparently future attorneys don't like talking to each other very much.
sentences.chinese: 而显然，未来的律师们是不太喜欢彼此交谈的。

sentences.english: But I do not mean to give you the idea that talk is all it takes to be a good parent or stepparent.
sentences.chinese: 但我的意思并非只要交谈就能当好父母或继父继母。

sentences.english: But an interview is not an interrogation; it's a conversation.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试并非是审问，而是一次交谈。

sentences.english: He often parenthesizes a talk with jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他常常在交谈中插入几句玩笑话。

sentences.english: Raikkonen: Oh, we've had some discussions. But no email contact.
sentences.chinese: 我们会互相交谈，但没有电子邮件联系。

sentences.english: I dressed well and talked to staff in the store.
sentences.chinese: 我穿得很体面时髦，并且轻快的跟店员交谈。

sentences.english: The atmosphere will be filled with light music that would only serve as background as people converse with each other.
sentences.chinese: 人们彼此交谈时，周围弥漫着作为背景的轻音乐。

sentences.english: After dinner, we sat talking on the veranda .
sentences.chinese: 饭后我们坐在游廊上交谈。

definition: to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
